page.title: 01Farmland SW, Hurstpierpoint
page.content: The area lies in the lee of the South Downs. Predominantly arable land but also containing a quarter of the larger village of Hurstpierpoint; the smaller village of Albourne and part of the hamlet of Blackstone, the southern third is more wooded, mainly random deciduous but with one coniferous plantation. The roads passing through run E/W or N/S with the main London to Brighton trunk road dominating the eastern sector. The main industry is agriculture with mixed farming mainly cereal crops and cattle and sheep. In recent years smaller units selling garden produce/ requisites have emerged. With little other industry other than local service industry, residents are mainly either retired or travel to larger towns outside the block to work.
